location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.197 of 1853 from Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary of the Government, Bombay, to Captain Arnold Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: The letter is a covering letter, enclosing a copy of a letter from Her Majesty's Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs to the President of the Board of Control, dated 2 May 1853, in which Kemball's instructions to Commodore George Robinson, Commanding Officer Persian Gulf Squadron, for exacting fines for involvement in the slave trade, from the Arab chiefs of the Persian coast, are approved.
